lead_paragraph: SPERO--Cecile (Ceil) Schiffer, 88 of Kendal at Ithaca, NY passed away Thursday, July 14 from cancer. Born in Atlanta in 1927, she grew up in New York City, the daughter of Allyn M. and Belle (Solomon) Schiffer. She graduated high school from the Lincoln School of Teachers College, Columbia University, where she met James S. Spero. They were happily married for 63 years until his passing in 2011. Ceil graduated from the University of Wisconsin in 1948 and received a Master of Library Science from SUNY Albany in 1967, after many years of part-time study while raising her family. She was an Elementary School Librarian and eventually the School Library Coordinator for the entire Ithaca City School District until her retirement in 1986. She was always involved in volunteer work in Tompkins County, including with Family and Children's Services, which honored Jim and Ceil for their dedicated support in advancing mental health services by creating the Spero Family Fund for Child Psychiatry; the Tompkins County Public Library Foundation; and Kendal at Ithaca, where she was instrumental in setting up the residents' library. Jim and Ceil made significant gifts that transformed services and lives and in 2010 were chosen as Philanthropists of the Year by the Association of Fundraising Professionals, New York Finger Lakes Chapter. Ceil will be remembered for her warm generosity, joy in spending time with family and friends, and her love of books, dancing and theater. She was also predeceased by daughter Jean Spero and sister Herma Shore. She is survived by children Bette Spero (Daryl Rasuli) of Buffalo, NY, Donald Spero (Julie Cooper) of Croton-on-Hudson, NY, Nancy Spero (Rob Sullivan) of Ithaca, NY; grandchildren Susannah Spero and Samuel Spero; sister-in-law Miriam Spero; and many loving nieces, nephews, and special friends. Friends are invited to attend a celebration of her life on August 1st at 3:30pm at Kendal at Ithaca. Memorial contributions may be made to "The Spero Family Fund for Child Psychiatry" at Family and Children's Services, 127 West State Street, Ithaca, NY 14850 or the Tompkins County Public Library. Contact Bangs Funeral Home, 607-272-1922 for more information. 1/3
